structure.unit: Registration Of Certain Professions And Occupations

law.catch_line: Suspension, Revocation Or Cancellation Of Certificate, Registration, License Or Authority By Boards; Disciplinary Measures; Sanctions; Student Loan Defaulters; Review

text.section: engaged in conduct which places into question the holderâ€™s competence to practice the profession including, but not limited to, gross misconduct; practicing the profession fraudulently; practicing his profession beyond the authorized scope of his license, certificate, registration or authority; practicing the profession with gross incompetence; or practicing the profession with negligence on 1 or more than 1 occasion;
engaged in the practice of his profession while the ability to practice was impaired by alcohol or drugs;
violated any law, rule or regulation of the board of registration governing the practice of the profession;
been convicted of a criminal offense which is reasonably related to the practice of the profession;
engaged in dishonesty, fraud or deceit which is reasonably related to the practice of the profession;
knowingly permitted, aided or abetted an unauthorized person in performing activities requiring a license, certificate, registration or authority; or

had a license, certificate, registration or authority issued by another state or territory of the United States, the District of Columbia, or a foreign state or nation with authority to issue such a license, certificate, registration or authority revoked, cancelled, suspended, not renewed or otherwise acted against, or if the holder has been disciplined, if the basis for the action would constitute a basis for disciplinary action in the commonwealth.
suspend, revoke, cancel, decline to renew, or place on probation such license, certificate, registration or authority;

assess upon the holder a civil administrative penalty, as determined by the board, not to exceed $100 for a first violation; $500 for a second violation; $1,500 for a third violation; or $2,500 for a fourth or subsequent violation;
require the holder to complete additional education and training as a condition of retention or future consideration of reinstatement of the license, certificate, registration or authority;

require the holder to practice under appropriate supervision for a period of time as determined by the board as a condition of retention or future consideration of reinstatement of the license, certificate, registration or authority;

require the holder to participate in an alcohol or drug rehabilitation program as a condition of retention or future consideration of reinstatement of the license, certificate, registration or authority.
